meanings.definition: An open space surrounded by walls or buildings.
meanings.sent1: The courtyards in the old castle were filled with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: We sat in the courtyards of the school during lunchtime.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels played tag in the courtyards, much to the amusement of the students.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of courtyards, each holding a different memory.
meanings.sent5: The courtyards echoed with the sound of laughter and chatter.

meanings.definition: A space in front of a building.
meanings.sent1: The courtyards of the mansion were adorned with elegant statues.
meanings.sent2: The children played hopscotch in the courtyards of the school.
meanings.sent3: The courtyards welcomed visitors with open arms, inviting them to explore the grand building.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a vast courtyard, open and exposed to the world.
meanings.sent5: The courtyards gleamed under the bright sun, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.
